wikipedia_page.main: Anketell Moutray Read VC (27 October 1884 – 25 September 1915) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: * Anketell Moutray Read, 1st Battalion, Northamptonshire Regiment (posthumous).

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |Anketell Moutray Read ||British Army || 1915 || First World War || Hulloch
*Captain Anketell Moutray Read - First World War, 25 September 1915
*Anketell Moutray Read VC (1884–1915), English recipient of the Victoria Cross

* Battle of Loos — British forces took the French town of Loos-en-Gohelle but with substantial casualties and were unable to press their advantage. It was the first time the British used poison gas in World War I and also their first large-scale use of the new Kitchener's Army units. At least three Victoria Crosses were awarded posthumously for bravery in the field, with the recipients being Anketell Moutray Read, Arthur Forbes Gordon Kilby, and George Peachment.

link_mentions.page: List of people educated at Haileybury and Imperial Service College
response: ** Captain Anketell Moutray Read, VC, (attended United Services College 1898–1902)

Rose Hamilton Moutray Read was born in 1870, the eldest child of Edith and John Moutray Read, who was a Lt Colonel of the 4th Cheshire Regiment. Her youngest brother was Anketell Moutray Read, who earned a Victoria Cross during the First World War.
